choices.B: SELECT department_id "Dept.", LISTAGG (last_name, ‘;’) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY hire_date)" Employees" FROM employees GROUP BY department_id ORDER BY hire_date;
choices.D: SELECT department_id "Dept.", LISTAGG (last_name, ‘;’) WITHIN GROUP ORDER BY (hire_date)" Employees") FROM employees GROUP BY department_id ORDER BY department_id;
choices.C: SELECT department_id "Dept.", LISTAGG (last_name, ‘;’) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY hire_date)" Employees") FROM employees GROUP BY department_id ORDER BY hire_date;
choices.A: SELECT department_id "Dept.", LISTAGG (last_name, ‘;’) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY hire_date)" Employees" FROM employees GROUP BY department_id ORDER BY department_id;

questions.question_text:
Examine the structure of the EMPLOYEES table:
//IMG//

You want to generate a report that contains the department IDs and last names of employees ordered by hire date in their respective departments. Employees from one department must appear in a single row.
Which query will provide the required output?
